content.description: An easy start with giant bucket hand holds leads to the crux pulling over a slight bulge. From there it's straightforward climbing to the chains, joining Low Voltage Left for the last 20 feet to the chains.
content.protection: 7 bolts, chain anchor shared with Low Voltage Left.
content.location: The trail will place you right at the base of this climb. Located just right of the highly featured, low angle slab leading up to the base of the Carolyn in the City pillar.

content.description: A steep start with some nice features and fun moves leads to easier climbing above where you join up with Low Voltage Right for the last 20 feet or so.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chain anchor shared with Low Voltage Right
content.location: The trail will place you right at the base of Low Voltage Right. Scramble up the easy slab and watch for bolts on the steep, highly featured face to your right.

content.description: A fantastic route that climbs high quality patina to a balancy crux right before the chains. This route would likely be mobbed by the masses 24/7 with a slightly shorter approach.
content.location: Follow the trail past the obvious, well worn base area for Low Voltage Right/Left. Eventually you'll run into a sign for the Lions Head and a trail junction. Cut left to the south end of the Geowatt formation where you will spot this obvious route. Faces south.

content.description: Start behind the boulder and work up the nice pillar feature. Crux seemed to be passing the bulge/overhang about 20 feet up.
content.protection: A 50/50 split between bolts and gear. Small to medium cams, 3 bolts, chain anchor. Yellow Metolius or equivalent was ideal for protecting the last 15 feet to the anchor.
content.location: The trail will put you right at the base of Low Voltage Right. Scramble up the easy slab to belay at the base of the pillar right in the corner.

content.description: Start off with some fun moves to get your feet established near the first bolt. Work upward using decent holds and edges that seem to get smaller and smaller the closer you get to the chains.
content.location: Follow the trail roughly 50 feet down from Low Voltage Right. Just as you reach some large boulders watch for a faint trail that cuts left up toward the wall.
